column2: laŭs ejus in ecclésia sanctórum. ^ Sing ye to the Lord a new canticle~
column3: let his praise be in the church of the saints.

column1: 2 ^ Laĕtétur Isráhel in eo qŭi fecit eum, et fílii Siónis exsùltent in reǧe suo. ^ Let Israel rejoice in him that made him, and let the children of Sion be joyful in their king.

column2: in tìmpano et psaltério psallant ei. ^ Let them praise his name in choir~
column3: let them sing to him with the timbrel and the psaltery.

column1: 4 ^ Qŭia beneplácitum est Dòmino in pòpulo suo, et exaltábit mansuétos in salútem. ^ For the Lord is well pleased with his people, and he will exalt the meek unto salvation.

column2: laĕtabùntur in cubílibus suîs. ^ The saints shall rejoice in glory~
column3: they shall be joyful in their beds.

column1: 6 ^ Exaltațiónes Dei in gùtture eórum, et gládii ancìpites in mánibus eórum~
column2: ^ The high praises of God shall be in their mouths, and two-edged swords in their hands~

column1: 7 ^ ad facièndam vindìctam in națiónibus, increpațiónes in pòpulîs~
column2: ^ to execute vengeance upon the nations, chastisements among the people~

column1: 8 ^ ad alligándos reǧes eórum in compèdibus, et nóbiles eórum in mánicîs fèrreîs~
column2: ^ to bind their kings with fetters, and their nobles with manacles of iron~

column1: 9 ^ ut fáciant in eîs judìcium conscríptum~
column2: glória haĕc est òmnibus sanctîs ejus. Allelúja. ^ to execute upon them the judgment that is written~
column3: this glory is to all his saints. Alleluia.
